newsitem.title: UK: Gold pressured in early Europe, trades below $338.
newsitem.headline: Gold pressured in early Europe, trades below $338.

text.p: The recent declines in gold bullion prices were showing few signs of abating in early European trading as prices slipped below expected support at around $338.00 an ounce.
Several traders believed that prices had the potential to tumble further and were targeting the April 1993 low of $334.40 and possibly lower.
A strong dollar and a fear of fresh producer selling and long liquidation was continuing to keep the market on the defensive.
At 0830 GMT spot gold was quoted $337.60/$338.10, down on Tuesday's London close of $339.30/$339.80.
Below $334.40 there is some support available at $332 and $330, followed by the March 1993 low of $325.
